title: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson in 'grips of cocaine addiction' just months before she died
text:
Tara Palmer-Tomkinson addresses drug and family struggles Share this video Watch Next 
“She was never comfortable becoming older. It was hard for her to see herself in that role and she was very frail.” 
Meanwhile, it emerged that Tara could have been dating a “difficult” older man for five months before her death. 
She was seen with the man on Saturday afternoon by a friend who worked in local gastropub The Bottlery. 
Viktor Krrashi said Tara had changed over the last three years, losing a lot of weight, despite claiming she put on a stone over Christmas. An ambulance at the London home of socialite Tara Palmer Tomkinson (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Her new boyfriend was in his early 50s with short grey hair and not from England, according to the barman. 
Vicktor said he was not taken with the man and considered him “difficult”. Once they started dating, Tara’s previously weekly visits for wine and champagne faded out. 
Tara was with her new mystery man on Saturday, Viktor claims. 
“She stopped at the door and said Hi,” he said. She looked thin and ill but she was always happy.” Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's car (Photo: TIM ANDERSON) 
A builder working on Tara’s apartment block claimed she had been behaving erratically. 
Last Friday, one of his colleagues had described her as “acting crazy” at around 4pm. 
The man, who did not want to be named, recounted his friend’s interaction with Tara, saying: “He said she had come downstairs to talk to them and she was acting crazy. She was banging on the door. Inside Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's car (Photo: TIM ANDERSON) 
“I don’t know what they were talking about.” 
And a local cafe owner said she was looking “very thin” in the weeks leading up to her death - despite her sending a text message to a friend immediately after Christmas saying she was off for some “r&r” adding: “I put on a stone.” 
The cafe owner described her as “away with fairies” when he last saw her. The driver's well of Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's car (Photo: TIM ANDERSON) 
The former model, who used to regularly get a latte at the cafe on the corner of her street in Earls Court, west London, also had her shopping hand picked and delivered to her door by her local off-licence. 
Sammy Chaoui, who owns Cafe Du Coin, remembered Tara as “bubbly” and says she used to visit at least once a week to get her coffee. 
“She was very bubbly, always happy,” the cafe owner said. “She was fantastic, she was on really good form, there weren’t any problems. She always looked very thin, she has lost a lot of weight. 
“I saw her around six weeks ago but haven’t seen her since. She looked like she was away with the fairies." Like us on Facebook
